script.title: Census Data Correlation
script.description: Correlate another table with US Census data.  Expands a data set dimensions by finding population segments that correlate with the master table.
instructions: Pre-requisite is Census Normalize, run that at least once.
Specify JOIN, PASS, SUM, and CORRELATE columns to build the correlation query.
Define the DATASET and TABLE for the joinable source. Can be a view.
Choose the significance level.  More significance usually means more NULL results, balance quantity and quality using this value.
Specify where to write the results.
IMPORTANT: If you use VIEWS, you will have to delete them manually if the recipe changes.

field.name: join
field.description: Name of column to join on, must match Census Geo_Id column.

field.name: pass
field.description: Comma seperated list of columns to pass through.

field.name: sum
field.description: Comma seperated list of columns to sum, optional.

field.name: correlate
field.description: Comma seperated list of percentage columns to correlate.

field.name: from_table
field.description: Table to use as join data.

field.name: significance
field.description: Select level of significance to test.

field.name: type
field.description: Write Census_Percent as table or view.
